title: NotATether
author: NotATether
content: I am wondering if there are any hotkeys which I can control Sparrow wallet server (the terminal, NOT the GUI) with, so I don't have to be stuck with Tab and Shift-Tab.I am suspecting those red characters in each button are the hotkeys, but I could not figure out how to trigger the buttons.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: NotATether on January 04, 2023, 04:53:36 AMI am wondering if there are any hotkeys which I can control Sparrow wallet server (the terminal, NOT the GUI) with, so I don't have to be stuck with Tab and Shift-Tab.I am suspecting those red characters in each button are the hotkeys, but I could not figure out how to trigger the buttons.I never used it but can you check following instructions and let me know if that works?Quote1. Press the "Alt" key on your keyboard and then press the hotkey for the button you want to trigger. For example, if the hotkey for a button is "A," you would press "Alt+A" to trigger that button.2. Press the "Ctrl" key on your keyboard and then press the hotkey for the button you want to trigger. For example, if the hotkey for a button is "A," you would press "Ctrl+A" to trigger that button.You may also be able to use the "Shift" key in combination with the hotkey to trigger a button, depending on the specific hotkey and button.Keep in mind that the hotkeys for each button may vary, so you may need to refer to the documentation for the Sparrow Wallet or try different combinations of keys to find the correct hotkey for a particular button.I will be puzzled if it works.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Update: I reached out to Craig Raw on the Sparrow Wallet telegram channel, and he said the colored letters don't do anything. So it looks like my suspicions were right; they are just for decoration (inserted by a 3rd party UI library, in fact).
